examples: They neither comb their Head, nor wash their Face,
But think their virtuous Nastiness a grace.

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Indecency; corruption; unkindness, meanness, spite, harshness, cruelty.
examples: Among current novelists, Martin Amis lacks intellectual force but is well supplied with nastiness, which occasionally resembles humor.
During the day, the surrounding blocks are no better, full of cheesy bars, tacky shops and brash, neon nastiness.

entries.meaning: (countable) A nasty action, object, quality, etc. (all senses of nasty).
examples: If we, who are educated, habitually submit to have copper in our preserves, red-lead in our cayenne, alum in our bread, pigments in our tea, and ineffable nastinesses in our fish-sauce, what can we expect of the poor?
